definition: To repel or fend off something, typically used to describe the action of defending against an attack, threat, or danger. It involves actively preventing or resisting the intrusion, harm, or impact of an external force or undesirable situation.

examples.english: He was able to repel the attack.

examples.german: Die Mannschaft konnte den Ball abwehren.
examples.english: The team was able to defend against the ball.
He tried to fend off the criticism.
The fence is meant to deter intruders.

examples.german: Sie konnte die Gefahr erfolgreich abwehren.
